member.name: T:WW.OpenGL.Win.WGL
member.summary: This class contains OpenGL utility methods specific to the Windows platform.

member.name: M:WW.OpenGL.Win.WGL.GetDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the device context of the window with given handle.
member.param: Handle to window

member.name: M:WW.OpenGL.Win.WGL.ChoosePixelFormat(System.IntPtr,WW.OpenGL.Win.PixelFormatDescriptor@)
member.summary: Retrieves an index for a pixel format closest to what is passed.
member.param: Device context
Pixel Format Descriptor struct
member.returns: The one-based pixel format index. Returns zero if the call failed.

member.name: M:WW.OpenGL.Win.WGL.DescribePixelFormat(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.UInt32,WW.OpenGL.Win.PixelFormatDescriptor@)
member.summary: Obtains information about the pixel format identified by pixelFormat of the device associated with hdc. The function sets the members of the PixelFormatDescriptor structure pointed to by pfd with that pixel format data.
member.param: Device context
Pixelformat index
Size (in bytes) of the pixelformat descriptor object
The pixelformat descriptor object
member.returns: Returns maximum pixelformat index of the device context or zero in case of failure.

member.name: M:WW.OpenGL.Win.WGL.SetPixelFormat(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,WW.OpenGL.Win.PixelFormatDescriptor@)
member.summary: Sets the pixel format for the device context to the format specified by the index.
member.param: Device Context
Index to a pixel format returned ChoosePixelFormat (one-base).
The logical pixel format descriptor.

member.name: T:WW.OpenGL.GLGraphics
member.summary: Helper class for OpenGL drawing onto a device context using back buffering.

remarks.para: This class handles rendering on the back buffer and swapping the front and back buffers.
Anti-aliasing is provided optionally, see properties , and .

member.summary: Constructor.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.summary: Finalizer releasing all OpenGL resources.

member.name: M:WW.OpenGL.GLGraphics.Initialize(WW.OpenGL.RenderingContext)
member.summary: Initialize the graphics using given OpenGL rendering context.
member.remarks: This object will become the owner of the rendering context and will dispose it when this object is disposed.

member.name: M:WW.OpenGL.GLGraphics.Paint(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Paint.

member.name: M:WW.OpenGL.GLGraphics.Paint(WW.OpenGL.RenderingContext,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Paint the scene.

remarks.para: Calls , and optionally handles anti aliasing by modifying the projection matrix using jitter vectors. In case anti aliasing is enabled, DrawSceneHelper is called multiple times.
This method also handles swapping buffers.

member.name: T:NineRays.Decompiler.NotDecompile
member.summary: This attribute you can use in your assemblies to prevent from Spices.Net Decompiler decompilation You can attach this attribute to type(class) or to entire assembly Simply attach this attribute to assembly attributes (usually located in AssemblyInfo.cs) as following: [assembly: NineRays.Decompiler.NotDecompile] Warning: If you use antiILDASM do not include and attach this attribute to your assembly In this case Spices.Obfuscator embeds this attribute and attaches to assembly attributes automatically

member.name: T:NineRays.Obfuscator.DontEncryptStringsAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to disable string encryption on some methos or constructor

member.name: T:NineRays.Obfuscator.SpecialNamespaceAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to define namespace of the obfuscated type

member.name: T:NineRays.Obfuscator.SpecialNameAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to define name of the obfuscated type

member.name: T:NineRays.Obfuscator.ObfuscateAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to include member into obfuscation

member.name: T:NineRays.Obfuscator.NotObfuscateAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to exclude member from obfuscation

member.name: T:NineRays.Obfuscator.NotObfuscateMembersAttribute
member.summary: Allows to exclude from obfuscation classes that matches attribute pattern string Note: pattern string will be used for analysis only on the assembly, that attribute attached Analysis based on member fully qualified name Example: [assembly:NineRays.Obfuscator.NotObfuscateMembersAttribute("MyCompany.Fo*")] - will be exluded all types with names beginning MyCompany.Fo (MyCompany.Foo, MyCompany.ForEachEnumerator) and his members (methods, fields, properties)

member.name: T:WW.OpenGL.GL
member.summary: OpenGL utility class with wrapper methods.

remarks.para: OpenGL constants can be used in the form of type safe enumerations for maximum usability. Enum is an example of this: methods and takes this capability as a parameter. This makes it harder to pass the wrong OpenGL constant as a method parameter and the auto-completion can now greatly improve programming speed, since the IDE will suggest which enums can be used after typing GL.Enable(. Some OpenGL methods have been overloaded, where more than one enum can be passed as a parameter (see again e.g. ).
Some overloads are created to directly operate on the WW.Math structs, like and (where there is no or negligible performance penalty). Methods and are examples of these.

member.name: T:WW.OpenGL.RenderingContext
member.summary: Convenience wrapper around the OpenGL rendering context.

remarks.para: Per thread one rendering context can be current (see ).

Makes sure to dispose this wrapper as soon as possible. This wrapper may not be disposed while the OpenGL rendering context is still current on another thread. When just releasing this rendering context wrapper while the wrapped OpenGL rendering context is still current (in e.g. the main thread), this wrapper will be disposed of in the garbage collection thread through the finalizer and will cause an error. See for more details the MSDN documentation on the wglDeleteContext Function (It is illegal to call wglDeleteContext while the rendering context is current on another thread).

member.name: M:WW.OpenGL.RenderingContext.MakeCurrent
member.summary: Makes this rendering context current for OpenGL.
